1: -module(cplt_SUITE).
    2: 
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
    5: -include_lib("dialyzer/src/dialyzer.hrl").
    6: -include("dialyzer_test_constants.hrl").
    7: 
    8: -export([suite/0, all/0,
    9:          build_plt/1, beam_tests/1, update_plt/1,
   10:          local_fun_same_as_callback/1,
   11:          remove_plt/1, run_plt_check/1, run_succ_typings/1,
   12:          bad_dialyzer_attr/1, merge_plts/1, bad_record_type/1,
   13:          letrec_rvals/1,
   14:          missing_plt_file/1,
   15:          build_xdg_plt/1,
   16:          mod_dep_from_behaviour/1,
   17:          mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_used/1,
   18:          mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_unused/1,
   19:          mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_type/1,
   20:          mod_dep_from_overloaded_callback/1,
   21:          mod_dep_from_exported_overloaded_fun_spec/1,
   22:          mod_dep_from_unexported_overloaded_fun_spec/1,
   23:          mod_dep_from_callback_constraint/1,
   24:          mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_constraint/1,
   25:          mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_constraint/1,
   26:          mod_dep_from_exported_type/1,
   27:          mod_dep_from_callback_return/1,
   28:          mod_dep_from_callback_args/1,
   29:          mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type_args/1,
   30:          mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type_args/1,
   31:          mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type/1,
   32:          mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type/1,
   33:          mod_dep_from_unexported_type_args/1,
   34:          mod_dep_from_exported_type_args/1,
   35:          mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_args/1,
   36:          mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_args/1,
   37:          mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_return/1,
   38:          mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_return/1,
   39:          mod_dep_from_unexported_type/1,
   40:          adding_warning_apps_after_a_run_without_them_causes_any_new_warnings_to_be_reported/1,
   41:          removing_warning_apps_after_a_run_with_them_causes_any_warnings_for_the_removed_apps_not_to_be_reported/1,
   42:          removing_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_does_not_result_in_old_warnings_being_printed/1,
   43:          adding_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_results_in_new_warnings_being_printed/1
   44:         ]).
   45: 
   46: suite() ->
   47:   [{timetrap, ?plt_timeout}].
   48: 
   49: all() -> [build_plt, build_xdg_plt, beam_tests, update_plt, run_plt_check,
   50:           remove_plt, run_succ_typings, local_fun_same_as_callback,
   51:           bad_dialyzer_attr, merge_plts, bad_record_type,
   52:           letrec_rvals,
   53:           missing_plt_file,
   54:           mod_dep_from_behaviour,
   55:           mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_used,
   56:           mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_unused,
   57:           mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_type,
   58:           mod_dep_from_overloaded_callback,
   59:           mod_dep_from_exported_overloaded_fun_spec,
   60:           mod_dep_from_unexported_overloaded_fun_spec,
   61:           mod_dep_from_callback_constraint,
   62:           mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_constraint,
   63:           mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_constraint,
   64:           mod_dep_from_exported_type,
   65:           mod_dep_from_callback_return,
   66:           mod_dep_from_callback_args,
   67:           mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type_args,
   68:           mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type_args,
   69:           mod_dep_from_unexported_opaque_type,
   70:           mod_dep_from_exported_opaque_type,
   71:           mod_dep_from_unexported_type_args,
   72:           mod_dep_from_exported_type_args,
   73:           mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_args,
   74:           mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_args,
   75:           mod_dep_from_unexported_fun_spec_return,
   76:           mod_dep_from_exported_fun_spec_return,
   77:           mod_dep_from_unexported_type,
   78:           adding_warning_apps_after_a_run_without_them_causes_any_new_warnings_to_be_reported,
   79:           removing_warning_apps_after_a_run_with_them_causes_any_warnings_for_the_removed_apps_not_to_be_reported,
   80:           removing_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_does_not_result_in_old_warnings_being_printed,
   81:           adding_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_results_in_new_warnings_being_printed
   82:           ].
   83: 
   84: build_plt(Config) ->
   85:   OutDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   86:   case dialyzer_common:check_plt(OutDir) of
   87:     ok   -> ok;
   88:     fail -> ct:fail(plt_build_fail)
   89:   end.
   90: 
   91: build_xdg_plt(Config) ->
   92:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   93: 
   94:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
   95:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
   96:                   {win32, _} ->
   97:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
   98:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
   99:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  100:                   _ ->
  101:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  102:               end,
  103: 
  104:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  105: 
  106:     erpc:call(
  107:       Node,
  108:       fun() ->
  109:         ?assertMatch([], dialyzer:run(
  110:                            [{analysis_type, plt_build},
  111:                             {apps, [erts]},
  112:                             {warnings, [no_unknown]}])),
  113:         ?assertMatch(
  114:            {ok,_}, file:read_file(
  115:                      filename:join(
  116:                        filename:basedir(user_cache, "erlang"),
  117:                        ".dialyzer_plt")))
  118:       end),
  119: 
  120:     peer:stop(Peer).
  121: 
  122: beam_tests(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  124:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "beam_tests.plt"),
  125:     Src = <<"
  126:         -module(no_auto_import).
  127: 
  128:         %% Copied from erl_lint_SUITE.erl, clash6
  129: 
  130:         -export([size/1]).
  131: 
  132:         size([]) ->
  133:             0;
  134:         size({N,_}) ->
  135:             N;
  136:         size([_|T]) ->
  137:             1+size(T).
  138:     ">>,
  139:     Opts = [no_auto_import],
  140:     {ok, BeamFile} = compile(Config, Src, no_auto_import, Opts),
  141:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  142:     ok.
  143: 
  144: run_plt_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  145:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  146:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "run_plt_check.plt"),
  147:     Mod1 = <<"
  148: 	      -module(run_plt_check1).
  149: 	     ">>,
  150: 
  151:     Mod2A = <<"
  152: 	       -module(run_plt_check2).
  153: 	      ">>,
  154: 
  155:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1, run_plt_check1, []),
  156:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2A, run_plt_check2, []),
  157:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile1, BeamFile2], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  158: 
  159:     Mod2B = <<"
  160: 	       -module(run_plt_check2).
  161: 
  162: 	       -export([call/1]).
  163: 
  164: 	       call(X) -> run_plt_check1:call(X).
  165: 	     ">>,
  166: 
  167:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2B, run_plt_check2, []),
  168: 
  169:     %% callgraph warning as run_plt_check2:call/1 makes a call to unexported
  170:     %% function run_plt_check1:call/1.
  171:     [_] = run_dialyzer(plt_check, [], [{init_plt, Plt}]),
  172: 
  173:     ok.
  174: 
  175: run_succ_typings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  176:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  177:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "run_succ_typings.plt"),
  178:     Mod1A = <<"
  179: 	       -module(run_succ_typings1).
  180: 
  181: 	       -export([call/0]).
  182: 
  183: 	       call() -> a.
  184: 	      ">>,
  185: 
  186:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1A, run_succ_typings1, []),
  187:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile1], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  188: 
  189:     Mod1B = <<"
  190: 	       -module(run_succ_typings1).
  191: 
  192: 	       -export([call/0]).
  193: 
  194: 	       call() -> b.
  195: 	     ">>,
  196: 
  197:     Mod2 = <<"
  198: 	      -module(run_succ_typings2).
  199: 
  200: 	      -export([call/0]).
  201: 
  202: 	      -spec call() -> b.
  203: 	      call() -> run_succ_typings1:call().
  204: 	     ">>,
  205: 
  206:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1B, run_succ_typings1, []),
  207:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2, run_succ_typings2, []),
  208:     %% contract types warning as run_succ_typings2:call/0 makes a call to
  209:     %% run_succ_typings1:call/0, which returns a (not b) in the PLT.
  210:     [_] = run_dialyzer(succ_typings, [BeamFile2],
  211:                        [{check_plt, false}, {init_plt, Plt}]),
  212:     %% warning not returned as run_succ_typings1 is updated in the PLT.
  213:     [] = run_dialyzer(succ_typings, [BeamFile2],
  214:                       [{check_plt, true}, {init_plt, Plt}]),
  215: 
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: %%% [James Fish:]
  219: %%% If a function is removed from a module and the module has previously
  220: %%% been added to a PLT, the function will not be removed from PLT when
  221: %%% the PLT is checked. This results in dialyzer failing to produce a
  222: %%% callgraph warning when doing success typings analysis if the remove
  223: %%% function is still called in another module
  224: %%% As the function is not removed from the PLT a prior warning, such as a
  225: %%% contract types warning, might be emitted when the removed function
  226: %%% nolonger exists.
  227: update_plt(Config) ->
  228:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  229:     Prog1 = <<"-module(plt_gc).
  230:                -export([one/0]).
  231:                one() ->
  232:                   one.">>,
  233:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, Prog1, plt_gc, []),
  234: 
  235:     ErlangBeam = case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
  236:                      non_existing ->
  237:                          filename:join([code:root_dir(),
  238:                                         "erts", "ebin", "erlang.beam"]);
  239:                      EBeam ->
  240:                          EBeam
  241:                  end,
  242:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "plt_gc.plt"),
  243:     Opts = [{check_plt, true}, {from, byte_code}],
  244:     [] = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, plt_build},
  245:                        {files, [Beam, ErlangBeam]},
  246:                        {output_plt, Plt},
  247:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  248: 
  249:     Prog2 = <<"-module(plt_gc).
  250:                -export([two/0]).
  251:                two() ->
  252:                   two.">>,
  253:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, Prog2, plt_gc, []),
  254: 
  255:     Test = <<"-module(test).
  256:               -export([test/0]).
  257:               -spec test() -> test.
  258:               test() ->
  259:                   plt_gc:one().">>,
  260:     {ok, TestBeam} = compile(Config, Test, test, []),
  261:     [{warn_callgraph, {_Filename, {5,19}}, {call_to_missing, [plt_gc,one,0]}}] =
  262:         dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, succ_typings},
  263:                       {files, [TestBeam]},
  264:                       {init_plt, Plt}] ++ Opts),
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: 
  268: %%% If a behaviour module contains an non-exported function with the same name
  269: %%% as one of the behaviour's callbacks, the callback info was inadvertently
  270: %%% deleted from the PLT as the dialyzer_plt:delete_list/2 function was cleaning
  271: %%% up the callback table. This bug was reported by Brujo Benavides.
  272: 
  273: local_fun_same_as_callback(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  274:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  275:     Prog1 =
  276:       <<"-module(bad_behaviour).
  277:          -callback bad() -> bad.
  278:          -export([publicly_bad/0]).
  279: 
  280:          %% @doc This function is here just to avoid the 'unused' warning for bad/0
  281:          publicly_bad() -> bad().
  282: 
  283:          %% @doc This function overlaps with the callback with the same name, and
  284:          %%      that was an issue for dialyzer since it's a private function.
  285:          bad() -> bad.">>,
  286:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, Prog1, bad_behaviour, []),
  287: 
  288:     ErlangBeam = case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
  289:                      non_existing ->
  290:                          filename:join([code:root_dir(),
  291:                                         "erts", "ebin", "erlang.beam"]);
  292:                      EBeam ->
  293:                          EBeam
  294:                  end,
  295:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "plt_bad_behaviour.plt"),
  296:     Opts = [{check_plt, true}, {from, byte_code}],
  297:     [] = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, plt_build},
  298:                        {files, [Beam, ErlangBeam]},
  299:                        {output_plt, Plt},
  300:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  301: 
  302:     Prog2 =
  303:         <<"-module(bad_child).
  304:            -behaviour(bad_behaviour).
  305: 
  306:            -export([bad/0]).
  307: 
  308:            %% @doc This function incorrectly implements bad_behaviour.
  309:            bad() -> not_bad.">>,
  310:     {ok, TestBeam} = compile(Config, Prog2, bad_child, []),
  311: 
  312:     [{warn_behaviour, _,
  313:       {callback_type_mismatch,
  314:        [bad_behaviour,bad,0,"'not_bad'","'bad'"]}}] =
  315:         dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, succ_typings},
  316:                       {files, [TestBeam]},
  317:                       {init_plt, Plt}] ++ Opts),
  318:     ok.
  319: 
  320: %%% [James Fish:]
  321: %%% Dialyzer always asserts that files and directories passed in its
  322: %%% options exist. Therefore it is not possible to remove a beam/module
  323: %%% from a PLT when the beam file no longer exists. Dialyzer should not to
  324: %%% check files exist on disk when removing from the PLT.
  325: remove_plt(Config) ->
  326:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  327:     Prog1 = <<"-module(m1).
  328:                -export([t/0]).
  329:                t() ->
  330:                   m2:a(a).">>,
  331:     {ok, Beam1} = compile(Config, Prog1, m1, []),
  332: 
  333:     Prog2 = <<"-module(m2).
  334:                -export([a/1]).
  335:                a(A) when is_integer(A) -> A.">>,
  336:     {ok, Beam2} = compile(Config, Prog2, m2, []),
  337: 
  338:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "remove.plt"),
  339:     Opts = [{check_plt, true}, {from, byte_code}],
  340: 
  341:     [{warn_return_no_exit, _, {no_return,[only_normal,t,0]}},
  342:      {warn_failing_call, _, {call, [m2,a,"('a')",_,_,_,_,_]}}] =
  343:         dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, plt_build},
  344:                       {files, [Beam1, Beam2]},
  345:                       {get_warnings, true},
  346:                       {output_plt, Plt},
  347:                       {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  348: 
  349:     [] = dialyzer:run([{init_plt, Plt},
  350:                        {files, [Beam2]},
  351:                        {analysis_type, plt_remove},
  352:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}]),
  353: 
  354:     [] =  dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, succ_typings},
  355:                         {files, [Beam1]},
  356:                         {init_plt, Plt},
  357:                         {warnings, [no_unknown]}] ++ Opts),
  358:     ok.
  359: 
  360: %% ERL-283, OTP-13979. As of OTP-14323 this test no longer does what
  361: %% it is designed to do--the linter stops every attempt to run the
  362: %% checks of Dialyzer's on bad dialyzer attributes. For the time
  363: %% being, the linter's error message are checked instead. The test
  364: %% needs to be updated when/if the Dialyzer can analyze Core Erlang
  365: %% without compiling abstract code.
  366: bad_dialyzer_attr(Config) ->
  367:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  368:     Source = lists:concat([dial, ".erl"]),
  369:     Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, Source),
  370:     ok = dialyzer_common:check_plt(PrivDir),
  371:     PltFilename = dialyzer_common:plt_file(PrivDir),
  372:     Opts = [{files, [Filename]},
  373:             {check_plt, false},
  374:             {from, src_code},
  375:             {init_plt, PltFilename}],
  376: 
  377:     Prog1 = <<"-module(dial).
  378:                -dialyzer({no_return, [undef/0]}).">>,
  379:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog1),
  380:     {dialyzer_error,
  381:      "Analysis failed with error:\n" ++ Str1} =
  382:         (catch dialyzer:run(Opts)),
  383:     S1 = string:find(Str1, "dial.erl:2:17: function undef/0 undefined"),
  384:     true = is_list(S1),
  385: 
  386:     Prog2 = <<"-module(dial).
  387:                -dialyzer({no_return, [{undef,1,2}]}).">>,
  388:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog2),
  389:     {dialyzer_error,
  390:      "Analysis failed with error:\n" ++ Str2} =
  391:         (catch dialyzer:run(Opts)),
  392:     S2 = string:find(Str2, "dial.erl:2:17: badly formed dialyzer "
  393:                            "attribute: {no_return,{undef,1,2}}"),
  394:     true = is_list(S2),
  395: 
  396:     ok.
  397: 
  398: merge_plts(Config) ->
  399:     %% A few checks of merging PLTs.
  400:     fun() ->
  401:             {Mod1, Mod2} = types(),
  402:             {BeamFiles, Plt1, Plt2} = create_plts(Mod1, Mod2, Config),
  403: 
  404:             {dialyzer_error,
  405:              "Could not merge PLTs since they are not disjoint"++_} =
  406:                 (catch run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  407:                                     [{plts, [Plt1, Plt1]}])),
  408:             [{warn_contract_types,_,_}] =
  409:                 run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  410:                              [{warnings, [unknown]},
  411:                               {plts, [Plt1, Plt2]}])
  412:     end(),
  413: 
  414:     fun() ->
  415:             {Mod1, Mod2} = callbacks(),
  416:             {BeamFiles, Plt1, Plt2} = create_plts(Mod1, Mod2, Config),
  417: 
  418:             {dialyzer_error,
  419:              "Could not merge PLTs since they are not disjoint"++_} =
  420:                 (catch run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  421:                                     [{plts, [Plt1, Plt1]}])),
  422:             [] =
  423:                 run_dialyzer(succ_typings, BeamFiles,
  424:                              [{warnings, [unknown]},
  425:                               {plts, [Plt1, Plt2]}])
  426:     end(),
  427: 
  428:     ok.
  429: 
  430: types() ->
  431:     Mod1 = <<"-module(merge_plts_1).
  432:               -export([f/0]).
  433:               -export_type([t/0]).
  434:               -type t() :: merge_plts_2:t().
  435:               -spec f() -> t().
  436:               f() -> 1. % Not an atom().
  437: 	      ">>,
  438:     Mod2 = <<"-module(merge_plts_2).
  439:               -export_type([t/0]).
  440:               -type t() :: atom().
  441: 	     ">>,
  442:     {Mod1, Mod2}.
  443: 
  444: callbacks() -> %% A very shallow test.
  445:     Mod1 = <<"-module(merge_plts_1).
  446:               -callback t() -> merge_plts_2:t().
  447: 	      ">>,
  448:     Mod2 = <<"-module(merge_plts_2).
  449:               -export_type([t/0]).
  450:               -type t() :: atom().
  451: 	     ">>,
  452:     {Mod1, Mod2}.
  453: 
  454: create_plts(Mod1, Mod2, Config) ->
  455:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  456:     Plt1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "merge_plts_1.plt"),
  457:     Plt2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "merge_plts_2.plt"),
  458:     ErlangBeam = erlang_beam(),
  459: 
  460:     {ok, BeamFile1} = compile(Config, Mod1, merge_plts_1, []),
  461:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [ErlangBeam,BeamFile1], [{output_plt,Plt1}]),
  462: 
  463:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Mod2, merge_plts_2, []),
  464:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile2], [{output_plt, Plt2}]),
  465:     {[BeamFile1, BeamFile2], Plt1, Plt2}.
  466: 
  467: %% End of merge_plts().
  468: 
  469: bad_record_type(Config) ->
  470:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  471:     Source = lists:concat([bad_record_type, ".erl"]),
  472:     Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, Source),
  473:     PltFilename = dialyzer_common:plt_file(PrivDir),
  474: 
  475:     Opts = [{files, [Filename]},
  476:             {check_plt, false},
  477:             {from, src_code},
  478:             {init_plt, PltFilename}],
  479: 
  480:     Prog = <<"-module(bad_record_type).
  481:               -export([r/0]).
  482:               -record(r, {f = 3 :: integer()}).
  483:               -spec r() -> #r{f :: atom()}.
  484:               r() ->
  485:                   #r{}.">>,
  486:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog),
  487:     {dialyzer_error,
  488:      "Analysis failed with error:\n" ++ Str} =
  489:         (catch dialyzer:run(Opts)),
  490:     P = string:str(Str,
  491:                     "bad_record_type.erl:4:16: Illegal declaration of #r{f}"),
  492:     true = P > 0,
  493:     ok.
  494: 
  495: letrec_rvals(Config) ->
  496:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  497:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "letrec_rvals.plt"),
  498:     Prog = <<"
  499: -module(letrec_rvals).
  500: 
  501: -export([demo_fun/1]).
  502: 
  503: demo_fun(_Arg) ->
  504:     case ok of
  505:         _ ->
  506:             _Res = _Arg,
  507:             [ ok || _ <- [] ]
  508:     end,
  509:     _Res.
  510: 
  511: handle_info() ->
  512:     case chids_to_audit() of
  513:         {ChIds, St2} ->
  514:             [ ChId || ChId <- ChIds ],
  515:             ok
  516:     end,
  517:     check_done(St2).
  518: 
  519: chids_to_audit() ->
  520:     some_module:get_audit_list().
  521: 
  522: check_done(_) ->
  523:     ok.
  524:     ">>,
  525:     {ok, BeamFile} = compile(Config, Prog, letrec_rvals, []),
  526:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [BeamFile], [{output_plt, Plt}]),
  527:     ok.
  528: 
  529: %% GH-4501
  530: missing_plt_file(Config) ->
  531:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  532:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "missing_plt_file.plt"),
  533:     Prog2 = <<"-module(missing_plt_file2).
  534:               t() -> foo.">>,
  535:     {ok, BeamFile2} = compile(Config, Prog2, missing_plt_file2, []),
  536: 
  537:     true = missing_plt_file_1(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2),
  538:     true = missing_plt_file_2(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2),
  539:     true = missing_plt_file_3(),
  540:     ok.
  541: 
  542: missing_plt_file_1(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2) ->
  543:     BeamFile = create(Config, PltFile),
  544:     ok = file:delete(BeamFile),
  545:     try succ(PltFile, BeamFile2), false
  546:     catch throw:{dialyzer_error, _} -> true
  547:     end.
  548: 
  549: missing_plt_file_2(Config, PltFile, BeamFile2) ->
  550:     BeamFile = create(Config, PltFile),
  551:     ok = file:delete(BeamFile),
  552: 
  553:     Cmd = "dialyzer -q --plt " ++ PltFile ++ " " ++ BeamFile2,
  554:     io:format("Cmd `~p'\n", [Cmd]),
  555:     "\ndialyzer: File not found: " ++ _ = os:cmd(Cmd),
  556: 
  557:     try check(PltFile, BeamFile2), false
  558:     catch throw:{dialyzer_error, _} -> true
  559:     end.
  560: 
  561: missing_plt_file_3() ->
  562:     try dialyzer_cplt:from_file("no_such_file"), false
  563:     catch throw:{dialyzer_error, _} -> true
  564:     end.
  565: 
  566: create(Config, PltFile) ->
  567:     Prog = <<"-module(missing_plt_file).
  568:               t() -> foo.">>,
  569:     {ok, BeamFile} = compile(Config, Prog, missing_plt_file, []),
  570:     Files = [BeamFile],
  571:     _ = file:delete(PltFile),
  572:     [] = dialyzer:run([{files,Files},
  573:                        {output_plt, PltFile},
  574:                        {analysis_type, plt_build},
  575:                        {warnings, [no_unknown]}]),
  576:     BeamFile.
  577: 
  578: succ(PltFile, BeamFile2) ->
  579:     Files = [BeamFile2],
  580:     dialyzer:run([{files, Files},
  581:                   {plts,[PltFile]},
  582:                   {analysis_type, succ_typings}]).
  583: 
  584: check(PltFile, _BeamFile2) ->
  585:     dialyzer:run([{plts,[PltFile]},
  586:                   {analysis_type, plt_check}]).
  587: 
  588: mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_unused(Config) ->
  589:     DependerSrc = <<"
  590:       -module(depender).
  591: 
  592:       -record(my_record,
  593:         { num_field = type_deps:get_num() :: number(),
  594:           str_field,
  595:           bool_field
  596:         }).
  597:       ">>,
  598:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, []}],
  599:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  600: 
  601: mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_value_default_used(Config) ->
  602:     DependerSrc = <<"
  603:       -module(depender).
  604:       -export([f/0]).
  605: 
  606:       -record(my_record,
  607:         { num_field = type_deps:get_num() :: number(),
  608:           str_field,
  609:           bool_field
  610:         }).
  611: 
  612:       f() -> #my_record{str_field = \"foo\", bool_field = true}. % type_deps:get_num() used implicitly here
  613:       ">>,
  614:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  615:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  616: 
  617: mod_dep_from_behaviour(Config) ->
  618:     DependerSrc = <<"
  619:       -module(depender).
  620:       -behaviour(type_deps).
  621:       -export([quux/1]).
  622: 
  623:       quux(N) -> N + 1. % Depends on behaviour module to check the callback implementation
  624:       ">>,
  625:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  626:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  627: 
  628: mod_dep_from_record_definition_field_type(Config) ->
  629:     DependerSrc = <<"
  630:       -module(depender).
  631: 
  632:       -record(my_record,
  633:         { num_field = 1 :: type_deps:number_like(),
  634:           str_field,
  635:           bool_field
  636:         }).
  637:       ">>,
  638:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  639:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  640: 
  641: mod_dep_from_overloaded_callback(Config) ->
  642:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  643:       -module(depender).
  644: 
  645:       -callback f(string()) -> string()
  646:                 ; (type_deps:number_like()) -> type_deps:number_like().
  647:       ">>,
  648:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  649:       -module(depender).
  650: 
  651:       -callback f(type_deps:number_like()) -> type_deps:number_like()
  652:                 ; (string()) -> string().
  653:       ">>,
  654:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  655:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  656:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  657: 
  658: mod_dep_from_exported_overloaded_fun_spec(Config) ->
  659:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  660:       -module(depender).
  661:       -export([f/1]).
  662: 
  663:       -spec f({a, atom()}) -> atom()
  664:             ; ({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like().
  665:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X;
  666:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X.
  667:       ">>,
  668:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  669:       -module(depender).
  670:       -export([f/1]).
  671: 
  672:       -spec f({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like()
  673:             ; ({a, atom()}) -> atom().
  674:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X;
  675:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X.
  676:       ">>,
  677:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  678:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  679:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  680: 
  681: mod_dep_from_unexported_overloaded_fun_spec(Config) ->
  682:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  683:       -module(depender).
  684:       -compile({nowarn_unused_function, [f/1]}).
  685: 
  686:       -spec f({a, atom()}) -> atom()
  687:             ; ({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like().
  688:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X;
  689:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X.
  690:       ">>,
  691:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  692:       -module(depender).
  693:       -compile({nowarn_unused_function, [f/1]}).
  694: 
  695:       -spec f({n, type_deps:number_like()}) -> type_deps:number_like()
  696:             ; ({a, atom()}) -> atom().
  697:       f({n, X}) when is_number(X) -> X;
  698:       f({a, X}) when is_atom(X) -> X.
  699:       ">>,
  700:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  701:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  702:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  703: 
  704: mod_dep_from_callback_constraint(Config) ->
  705:     DependerSrc1 = <<"
  706:       -module(depender).
  707: 
  708:       -callback f(X) -> string() when X :: type_deps:number_like().
  709:       ">>,
  710:     DependerSrc2 = <<"
  711:       -module(depender).
  712: 
  713:       -callback f(X :: type_deps:number_like()) -> string().
  714:       ">>,
  715:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  716:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc1, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt),
  717:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc2, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  718:

  726:       ">>,
  727:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  728:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  729:

  734:

  737:       ">>,
  738:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],

  756:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],

  774:       ">>,

  796:

  845:       ">>,

  853:

  856:       ">>,

  859: 
  860: mod_dep_from_unexported_type(Config) ->
  861:     DependerSrc = <<"

  863: 
  864:       -type my_type() :: type_deps:list_like(number()).
  865:       ">>,
  866:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  867:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  868: 
  869: mod_dep_from_exported_type(Config) ->
  870:     DependerSrc = <<"
  871:       -module(depender).
  872:       -export_type([my_type/0]).
  873: 
  874:       -type my_type() :: type_deps:list_like(number()).
  875:       ">>,
  876:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt = [{depender, []}, {type_deps, [depender]}],
  877:     ok = check_plt_deps(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt).
  878: 
  879: check_plt_deps(Config, TestName, DependerSrc, ExpectedTypeDepsInPltUnsorted) ->
  880:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  881:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(TestName) ++ ".plt"),
  882:     {ok, DepsBeamFile} = compile(Config, type_deps, []),
  883:     {ok, DependerBeamFile} = compile(Config, DependerSrc, depender, []),
  884:     [] = run_dialyzer(plt_build, [DependerBeamFile, DepsBeamFile], [{output_plt, PltFile}]),
  885:     {_ResPlt, #plt_info{mod_deps = DepsByModule}} = dialyzer_cplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFile),
  886: 
  887:     ActualTypeDepsInPlt =
  888:       lists:sort(dict:to_list(dict:erase(erlang, DepsByModule))),
  889:     ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt =
  890:       lists:usort(ExpectedTypeDepsInPltUnsorted),
  891: 
  892:     ?assertEqual(
  893:       ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt,
  894:       ActualTypeDepsInPlt,
  895:       {missing, ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt -- ActualTypeDepsInPlt,
  896:        extra, ActualTypeDepsInPlt -- ExpectedTypeDepsInPlt}).
  897: 
  898: erlang_beam() ->
  899:     case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
  900:         non_existing ->
  901:             filename:join([code:root_dir(),
  902:                            "erts", "ebin", "erlang.beam"]);
  903:         EBeam ->
  904:             EBeam
  905:     end.
  906: 
  907: %% Builds the named module using the source in the cplt_SUITE_data dir
  908: compile(Config, Module, CompileOpts) ->
  909:     Source = lists:concat([Module, ".erl"]),
  910:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  911:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  912:     SrcFilename = filename:join([DataDir, Source]),
  913:     Opts = [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info | CompileOpts],
  914:     {ok, Module} = compile:file(SrcFilename, Opts),
  915:     {ok, filename:join([PrivDir, lists:concat([Module, ".beam"])])}.
  916: 
  917: %% Builds the named module using the literal source given
  918: compile(Config, Prog, Module, CompileOpts) ->
  919:     Source = lists:concat([Module, ".erl"]),
  920:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  921:     Filename = filename:join([PrivDir, Source]),
  922:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog),
  923:     Opts = [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info | CompileOpts],
  924:     {ok, Module} = compile:file(Filename, Opts),
  925:     {ok, filename:join([PrivDir, lists:concat([Module, ".beam"])])}.
  926: 
  927: run_dialyzer(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
  928:     dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, Analysis},
  929:                   {files, Files},
  930:                   {from, byte_code},
  931:                   {warnings, [no_unknown]} |
  932:                   Opts]).
  933: 
  934: m_src_without_warning() -> <<"
  935:   -module(m).
  936:   -export([updt/3]).
  937: 
  938:   updt(X, K, V) -> X#{ K => V }.
  939:   ">>.
  940: 
  941: m_src_with_warning() -> <<"
  942:   -module(m).
  943:   -export([updt/3]).
  944: 
  945:   -spec updt(list(), term(), term()) -> list(). % Warning: Spec is wrong! Function takes a map, not a list
  946:   updt(X, K, V) -> X#{ K => V }.
  947:   ">>.
  948: 
  949: adding_warning_apps_after_a_run_without_them_causes_any_new_warnings_to_be_reported(Config) ->
  950:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  951:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
  952:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
  953:     OptsNoContractWarn = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}, {warnings, [no_contracts]}],
  954:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
  955:     [] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], OptsNoContractWarn),
  956:     ?assertMatch(
  957:       [{warn_contract_types,
  958:           {_, {5,4}},
  959:           {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
  960:       ],
  961:       run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], Opts)).
  962: 
  963: removing_warning_apps_after_a_run_with_them_causes_any_warnings_for_the_removed_apps_not_to_be_reported(Config) ->
  964:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  965:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
  966:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
  967:     OptsNoContractWarn = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}, {warnings, [no_contracts]}],
  968:     {ok, Beam} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
  969:     ?assertMatch(
  970:       [{warn_contract_types,
  971:           {_, {5,4}},
  972:           {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
  973:       ],
  974:       run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], Opts)),
  975:     ?assertEqual(
  976:        [],
  977:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [Beam], OptsNoContractWarn)).
  978: 
  979: removing_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_does_not_result_in_old_warnings_being_printed(Config) ->
  980:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  981:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
  982:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
  983:     {ok, BeamFileBefore} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
  984:     ?assertMatch(
  985:       [{warn_contract_types,
  986:           {_, {5,4}},
  987:           {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
  988:       ],
  989:       run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileBefore], Opts)),
  990:     {ok, BeamFileAfter} = compile(Config, m_src_without_warning(), m, []),
  991:     ?assertEqual(
  992:        [],
  993:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileAfter], Opts)).
  994: 
  995: adding_legal_warnings_with_existing_stored_warnings_in_plt_results_in_new_warnings_being_printed(Config) ->
  996:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  997:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".plt"),
  998:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFile]}],
  999:     {ok, BeamFileAfter} = compile(Config, m_src_without_warning(), m, []),
 1000:     ?assertEqual(
 1001:        [],
 1002:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileAfter], Opts)),
 1003:     {ok, BeamFileBefore} = compile(Config, m_src_with_warning(), m, []),
 1004:     ?assertMatch(
 1005:        [{warn_contract_types,
 1006:         {_, {5,4}},
 1007:         {invalid_contract,[m,updt,3,{[1],true},"([any()],term(),term()) -> [any()]","(map(),_,_) -> map()"]}}
 1008:        ],
 1009:        run_dialyzer(incremental, [BeamFileBefore], Opts)).
